content.question: Which of the following claims best explains why keratinocytes do not produce melanin?

choices.label: Keratinocytes do not contain the <math alttext="T Y R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mi>Y</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="T R P 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi><mi>R</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></mstyle></mrow></math>, and <math alttext="T R P 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> genes.

Keratinocytes do not contain the <math alttext="M C 1 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.
Keratinocytes do not express the <math alttext="M I T F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>I</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.
Keratinocytes do not express the <math alttext="P O M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.

content.answer: Keratinocytes do not express the <math alttext="M I T F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>I</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.
